context.p: Run euca_describe_nodes to verify if instance is there.

substep.cmd: Go to NC log for that NC and grep your instance ID and see if the instance is there.

ul.li:
If the instance is there: is there error message?
If there is an error message, this clues you in to some helpful information
No: go to CC log, grep instance ID

substep.cmd: No: go to CC log, grep Instance ID. Is it there error message?

ul.li: Yes: good- this clues you in to some helpful information

No: grep instance ID in cloud-output.log. Is there error message?
Yes: good - this clues you in to some helpful information
No: grep volume ID in SC log

step.cmd: If the instance is not there, log in as admin and run euca_describe_instance. Is the instance there?

ul.li:
If the instance is there, note your A2 and do the following.
Run euca_describe-az verbose.
Note the CC IP
Go to the CC log and grep Instance ID.
If the instance is not there, start over and run a new instance, recreate failure, and start these steps over.
